{{cpp/title|iswpunct}}
{{cpp/string/wide/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cwctype|
int iswpunct( std::wint_t ch );
}}

Checks if the given wide character is a punctuation character, i.e. it is one of {{tt|&lt;nowiki&gt;!"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\]^_`{|}~&lt;/nowiki&gt;}} or any punctuation character specific to the current locale.

{{cpp/string/wide/wint_t args}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|wide character}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Non-zero value if the wide character is a punctuation character, zero otherwise.

===Notes===
[https://www.open-std.org/JTC1/SC35/WG5/docs/30112d10.pdf ISO 30112] specifies which Unicode characters are include in POSIX punct category.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;clocale&gt;
#include &lt;cwctype&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    wchar_t c = L'\u2051'; // Two asterisks ('‚Åë')

    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::hex &lt;&lt; std::showbase &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha
              &lt;&lt; "in the default locale, iswpunct("
              &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;std::wint_t&gt;(c) &lt;&lt; ") = "
              &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;bool&gt;(std::iswpunct(c)) &lt;&lt; '\n';

    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "en_US.utf8");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "in Unicode locale, iswpunct("
              &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;std::wint_t&gt;(c) &lt;&lt; ") = "
              &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;bool&gt;(std::iswpunct(c)) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
in the default locale, iswpunct(0x2051) = false
in Unicode locale, iswpunct(0x2051) = true
}}
